bestBHT.bht: To fulfill the prophecy of Isaiah, Jesus came and resided in Capernaum. By dwelling there, Jesus not only fulfilled prophecy but also carried out God's plan. According to Isaiah, the regions mentioned in the prophecy had experienced suffering and would be honored by the presence of the Messiah. Capernaum became the significant place where Jesus publicly appeared, called his disciples, and initiated his ministry. His presence brought glory and transformation to the area mentioned in Isaiah's prophecy.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: 14. That it might be fulfilled which
was spoken by Esaias the prophet— (Isaiah 9:1;
Philip Schaff: The purpose of fulfilling prophecy ever involves the higher purpose of carrying out God’s plan thus revealed.
The Septuagint is quite incorrect here.
John Gill: Christ's dwelling in Capernaum accomplished a prophecy of the prophet Isaiah 9:1 and he went and dwelt there, that it might be fulfilled which he had spoken.

The meaning of which prophecy is that as those parts of the land of Israel, there mentioned, had suffered much [...] so they should be honored, and made very glorious, by the presence and conversation of the Messiah among them.
Here Jesus, the true Messiah, made his first appearance publicly; here he called his disciples, and began his ministry.

bhtAttempts.bht: To fulfill the prophecy spoken by Isaiah, Jesus went and dwelt in Capernaum. This act not only brought about the fulfillment of the prophecy but also played an integral role in carrying out God's divine plan. The words of Isaiah pointed to the suffering and subsequent honor that would come to those regions, as the Messiah's presence and ministry among them would bring glory and transformation. Capernaum became the significant location where Jesus made his public appearance, called his disciples, and initiated his ministry.

To fulfill the prophecy of Isaiah, Jesus came and resided in Capernaum. By dwelling there, Jesus not only fulfilled prophecy but also carried out God's plan. According to Isaiah, the regions mentioned in the prophecy had experienced suffering and would be honored by the presence of the Messiah. Capernaum became the significant place where Jesus publicly appeared, called his disciples, and initiated his ministry. His presence brought glory and transformation to the area mentioned in Isaiah's prophecy.

To carry out God's plan and fulfill the prophecy of Isaiah, Jesus went and dwelt in Capernaum. This act served the purpose of honoring the regions mentioned in the prophecy and bringing glory to them through the Messiah's presence. Capernaum became the significant location where Jesus publicly appeared, called his disciples, and began his ministry. Through his dwelling in Capernaum, Jesus demonstrated the fulfillment of Isaiah's words and initiated the transformative work of his ministry.

In order to fulfill the prophecy of Isaiah, Jesus went and dwelt in Capernaum. By doing so, Jesus not only fulfilled the prophecy but also carried out God's plan. Isaiah's words reveal that the regions mentioned in the prophecy had experienced suffering but would be honored through the presence of the Messiah. Capernaum became the significant place where Jesus made his first appearance, called his disciples, and began his ministry. Through his dwelling in Capernaum, Jesus brought about the fulfillment of prophecy and initiated the glorious work of his ministry among them.

To fulfill Isaiah's prophecy, Jesus went and dwelt in Capernaum. By doing so, Jesus not only fulfilled the prophecy but also carried out God's plan. Isaiah's words indicated that the regions mentioned had experienced suffering but would be honored through the presence of the Messiah. Capernaum became the place where Jesus made his first appearance, called his disciples, and began his ministry. Through his dwelling in Capernaum, Jesus brought about the fulfillment of prophecy and initiated his transformative ministry.
